title: Ticket #4597: 8.0.x->8.2.2 upgrade = collector crash (NETWORK_MAX_PENDING_CONNECTS)
description:
Report from Michael R Brady <mrbrady@syr.edu> of the Syracuse Orange Grid pool:

  There was a config option the mgr side didn't like (NETWORK_MAX_PENDING_CONNECTS) causing and the Collector to crash and condor_userprio command to fail.. removing that option fixed the problem with it crashing, but now Collector reports this:

09/17/14 22:28:31 WARNING: cannot register TCP update socket from <10.5.40.102:57527>: file descriptor safety level exceeded:  limit 8192,  registered socket count 8186,  fd 8192
09/17/14 22:28:31 WARNING: cannot register TCP update socket from <10.5.60.9:51764>: file descriptor safety level exceeded:  limit 8192,  registered socket count 8186,  fd 8192

  Even though the file descriptior limit is set to 65000 in the OS and in the local condor_config file (MAX_FILE_DESCRIPTORS)... didn't see this in the previous release.
remarks: I've been fiddling with this, but I can't reproduce this now. Can we mark this as abandoned, and revive it, if we see it again?
